contextId.occurrenceNote: It is possible that the word "feet" here may have been a more respectful way to refer to the genital area of the body. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
Moses used a polite way of saying God was going to destroy the Egyptian army. Alternate translation: "For God will kill the Egyptians" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: For you will never see again the Egyptians

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a polite way of talking about sleeping with their wives. Alternate translation: "do not sleep with your wives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: do not go near your wives

contextId.occurrenceNote: This includes things that a husband must do for his wife, including sleeping with her. Alternate translation: "and he must continue to sleep with her as before" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
Lying with someone is a euphemism for having sex. Alternate translation: "if he has sex with her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
This is a euphemism. Alternate translation: "Whoever has sexual relations with an animal" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
